wikipedia_page.main: Montagu Henry Edmund Cecil Towneley-Bertie, 13th Earl of Lindsey and 8th Earl of Abingdon (2 November 1887 – 11 September 1963), styled Lord Norreys between 1919 and 1928 and known as The 8th Earl of Abingdon from 1928 onwards, was an English peer.

response: Hole's wife, Joyce, was a lifelong friend of Elizabeth Bertie, the Countess of Abingdon and wife of Montagu Towneley-Bertie, 13th Earl of Lindsey.Burke's Peerage, Baronetage and Knightage, 2003, vol. 2, p. 2349 The Countess became especially close to Tahu and Joyce when her husband died in 1963, and when she died 15 years laterBurke's Peerage, Baronetage and Knightage, 2003, vol. 2, p. 2349 she bequeathed them all her possessions with a value of over £1.5 million. The collection passed to the Victoria and Albert Museum following Joyce's death in 1986.
*Montagu Towneley-Bertie, 13th Earl of Lindsey (1887–1963), English peer
* Montagu Towneley-Bertie, 13th Earl of Lindsey (2 November 1887 – 11 September 1963), English peer
